results.title: Does anybody need me anymore?
results.creator_credit: Paul Bogart and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Part of the “Being a woman” series. Observes the changes which occur in the marriage of a middle-aged couple when the wife decides to change her own lifestyle after her children are grown and gone. Raises issues regarding women’s roles, sex-role stereotyping, changing expectaions of the female role and the male perception of such topics.

results.title: The Mime of Marcel Marceau
results.creator_credit: Daniel Camus and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Scenes from various classes conducted by Marcel Marceau and the teachers of his school are intercut with actual performances including “The Maskmaker”, “The Painter” and “The Creation”. Looks at the work of Marcel Marceau, both private and public. it is in the private domain that we see the “other” side of him - that is to say, his everyday reality of teaching mime.

results.title: The Mole and the egg
results.brief_description: An animated children’s film about a mole who finds an abandoned hen’s egg and sets out to find the egg’s mother. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Franklin: wild river
results.creator_credit: Chris Noone, Stacey Gavrily, Michael Cordell and Wombat Films
results.brief_description: Documentary which looks at the controversy over the proposed damming of the Franklin and Gordon Rivers in South West Tasmania and argues for the conservation of this wilderness area. Provides a brief history of the region and follows a three week journey down the Franklin River with Dr. Bob Brown, a conservationist who has intimate knowledge of the river.

results.title: Elizabeth: the queen who shaped an age
results.creator_credit: John Paddy Carstairs, Helen Jean Secondari, John H. Secondari, John H Secondari Productions and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: This dramatic recreation of the reign of Elizabeth I of England is a study of political power used for noble ends. Elizabeth inherited a troubled and divided country. A Protestant ruler in a predominantly Protestant country, she held out as long as she could against Parliament’s desire to pass anti-Catholic laws. When she discovered there was a plot against her life, Elizabeth signed the execution order against her cousin, Mary, Queen of Scots even though she feared this would divide England firmly into two camps - Protestants and Catholics. Elizabeth I forged a great nation - a military power second to none, a glorious home for the arts, commerce and exploration, and a symbol of the Renaissance belief in the worth of man. Cast: Frances Cuka as Elizabeth I. Filmed at Hever Castle, Kent, England. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Up a tree
results.brief_description: Donald the lumberjack decides to saw down the tree in which Chip ‘n’ Dale live. A whirlwind of comedy ensues as the chipmunks proceed to deter the determined duck in any way they can.

results.title: Fire chief
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: First released in 1941, this film features the best from the second decade of the “Donald Duck” cartoons. This short is filled with one clever gag after another as Donald has a go at being fire chief.

results.title: Foods and fun: a nutrition adventure
results.creator_credit: Rick Reinert and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Animated film explaining the basics of good health: rest, exercise and a balanced diet. Stresses the need to start the day with a good breakfast. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Celebrations
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A documentary film presenting six different and authentic celebrations involving people in the multicultural community of Melbourne. Depicts an Aboriginal dance showing body decoration preparation, an Indonesian Muslim wedding celebration, an Australian child’s birthday party, a Greek nameday party, Christmas festivities and a Northern Italian Christmas celebration. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
